title: Transfer Samples from One Plate to Another
author: Opentrons
description:
This protocol allows the robot to transfer samples from a source plate to a destination plate using a P10 single-channel pipette. A CSV is required.
Your CSV should look like this:

To generate a .csv from Excel or another spreadsheet program, try "File" > "Save As" and select *.csv
process:
Upload your .csv in the field above.
Select your block A and B container types.
Download your protocol.
Upload your protocol into the OT App.
Set up your deck according to the deck map.
Calibrate your labware, tiprack and pipette using the OT App. For calibration tips, check out our support article.
Hit "Run".
Robot will transfer x uL of sample from plate defined by 'Block Start' to 'Block End'.
notes: Plate A is in slot 1, and plate B slot 2.

markdown.title: Transfer Samples from One Plate to Another
markdown.author: [Opentrons](http://www.opentrons.com/)
markdown.description:
This protocol allows the robot to transfer samples from a source plate to a destination plate using a P10 single-channel pipette. A CSV is required.

Your CSV should look like this:  
![csv format](https://s3.amazonaws.com/opentrons-protocol-library-website/custom-README-images/1250-stanford-university/csv_format.png)

To generate a `.csv` from Excel or another spreadsheet program, try "File" > "Save As" and select `*.csv`
markdown.process:
1. Upload your `.csv` in the field above.
2. Select your block A and B container types.
3. Download your protocol.
4. Upload your protocol into the [OT App](https://opentrons.com/ot-app).
5. Set up your deck according to the deck map.
6. Calibrate your labware, tiprack and pipette using the OT App. For calibration tips, check out our [support article](https://support.opentrons.com/ot-2/getting-started-software-setup/deck-calibration).
7. Hit "Run".
8. Robot will transfer x uL of sample from plate defined by 'Block Start' to 'Block End'.
markdown.notes: * Plate A is in slot 1, and plate B slot 2.
